name: MEM_PTR
description: MEMORY POINTER UPDATE (DOS only) This is a TAS Professional 3.0 command here for compatibility. There is no preferred TAS Professional 5.1 command/function.
syntax:
MEM_PTR mem_area# START start_val OCCURS #of_chrs_before_next SIZE size_of_ptr VAL
chg_value TIMES #_ptrs_to_chg DOwhat_to_do

parameters.name: mem_area#
parameters.description: This is the memory area to use. This must resolve to a value of 1 through 4.

parameters.name: start_val
parameters.description: The character position of the first pointer to be changed. The first character in the memory area is at position 1.

parameters.name: #_of_chrs_before_next
parameters.description: The total number of characters before the next pointer. If there are a total of 10 characters per element in the memory area and the pointer is part of that element then this would be 10.

parameters.name: size_of_ptr
parameters.description: This is the internal or csize of the pointer itself. If the pointer is O type (old form BCD) and has a display size of 5 then this would be 3 (5/2+rounding).

parameters.name: chg_value
parameters.description: The amount to add to or subtract from each pointer. NOTE: The size and type of this field must be the same as the pointer.

parameters.name: #_ptrs_to_chg
parameters.description: How many pointers do you want to change.

parameters.name: what_to_do
parameters.description: This must resolve to either A (add) or S (subtract).

comments: This is the equivalent of the TAS Professional 3.0 command Memory Pointer Update.
